title: Ticket #1368: New ClassAd function: regex_replace
description:
A new ClassAd function that returns the result of a search and replace would be handy.

I was asked if it's possible to basically re-implement condor_q, but with customizations for their particular queue.* I thought it was possible with -format, but it turns out it's not so easy. In particular, condor_q shows the basename(Cmd), but ClassAd functions lack equivalent functionality. "basename(Cmd)" would work, but seems overly specialized. Instead, I'd like to do something like: 

condor_q -format '%s\n' regex_replace(".*/", Cmd, "")

* For the curious, their jobs run under a wrapper, and seeing the CMD listed as "our_wrapper" wasn't helpful. They want the displayed CMD to the Cmd if it's not our_wrapper. If it is our_wrapper, look for the attribute real_command and display that.
